intro: Boehmeria listeri, commonly known as the silverleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stinging hairs. Boehmeria listeri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional medicine and for making textiles in some cultures.
